message: Wait... are those graves? There must be hundreds of them.
Thousands. The Battle of Ashenfell Ridge. Fought here two centuries ago.
Two centuries? But the markers look almost... fresh.
The desert preserves what it should let rot. Wood doesn't decay. Iron doesn't rust. Even the bones stay [slow factor=0.5]whole[/slow].
That's... unsettling. What were they fighting for?
Everything. Nothing. Two kingdoms claimed the same oasis. By the time the battle ended, both armies had bled the water source dry.
They killed the very thing they were fighting over?
Pride does that. Turns men into weapons that destroy their own purpose. The survivors buried their dead and left. Never came back.
Do you think they... [slow factor=0.3]regretted[/slow] it?
I think they realized too late that some victories cost more than defeat ever could.
Should we... say something? For them?

*stops, removes helmet* Eternal rest grant unto them, O Lord. May they find in death the peace they never knew in life. *replaces helmet* Their souls still need our prayers, Replacement. But right now, the living need our swords.
